description: Chester Lake is nestled among towering peaks of the Canadian Rockies in Peter Lougheed Provincial Park near Kananaskis Country and Spray Lake in Alberta. The Alpine Larch and Western Larch (Larix occidentalis) lives at high elevations in the Rocky Mountains of Alberta, British Columbia, Montana.October 3, 2014...the larch are turning color.
directions: Drive from Canmore  -approx. 40 minutes on Smith -Dorrien Trail to clearlymarked sign "Chester Lake" parking lot.From there follow marked trail. Gaining elevation approx 310 m. Expect already snow on the trial. Recommended good hiking boots.
title: Chester Lake - to see Golden Alpine Arches
